title: Learning in Britain
brief_description: No nation has a monopoly of knowledge but many centuries of learning and experience have made Britain a centre of study which attracts students from every part of the world. Famous places of learning are visited including universities, medical and agricultural schools, the great Inns of Court, and training colleges for teachers.
